description.p: RustConn is a modern connection manager for Linux with a GTK4/Wayland-native interface. Manage SSH, RDP, VNC, SPICE, Telnet, Serial, Kubernetes, and Zero Trust connections from a single application. Core protocols use embedded Rust implementations with no external dependencies required.

Organize connections into groups and tags, split terminals side by side, automate tasks with expect scripts and command snippets, and import from Remmina, Asbru-CM, MobaXterm, Royal TS, SSH config, or Ansible inventory.

ul.li: SSH, Telnet, Serial, and Kubernetes with embedded VTE terminals
RDP via IronRDP and VNC via vnc-rs with external client fallback
Zero Trust tunnels: AWS SSM, GCP IAP, Azure Bastion, Cloudflare, Teleport, Tailscale
Credential storage via KeePassXC, GNOME Keyring, Bitwarden, 1Password, or Passbolt
Split view, cluster commands, session logging, and Wake-on-LAN
